title: JavaScript
info: Primarily used with React; I am also familiar with vanilla JS.

title: HTML
info: I've been writing vanilla HTML since the early 2000s with HTML4. I'm excited to see what the future holds for this.

title: CSS
info: I've been writing vanilla CSS since the early 2000s. I am also familiar with some CSS frameworks & libraries, such as Sass and CSS Modules.

title: React
info: I believe React's greatest strength is in its flexibility - it doesn't require your project to be structured in any particular way.

title: Angular
info: My favorite part about Angular is that it forces your project to be well-structured and modular.

title: D3.js
info: Basic graphing, creating a calendar heatmap.

title: MongoDB
info: I use MongoDB for any of my personal projects that require centralized data storage.

title: IndexedDB
info: I use IndexedDB most of my personal projects that require data storage, as long as it doesn't need to be centralized or available anywhere. I like that the data is stored on the client, giving the user more control.

title: MySQL
info: MySQL is my go-to relational database system.

title: PHP
info: I picked up PHP in the interest of being able to maintain some older systems.

title: Svelte
info: I picked Svelte up for my capstone project at UMass Boston, where I extended an existing open-source project with new features.
